forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain. Mostly cloudy, with a low around 50. West wind 14 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 26 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

forecast.name: Tuesday
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain before 11am, then a chance of showers and thunderstorms between 11am and 2pm, then a chance of rain between 2pm and 5pm. Partly sunny, with a high near 56. West wind 16 to 22 mph, with gusts as high as 29 mph. Chance of precipitation is 30%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
As dusk unfurls over Downtown San Francisco, the air carries a hint of intrigue, laced with the spaciousness of partly cloudy skies, which promise a subtle dance of shadows later tonight. With temperatures settling near a cool 50 degrees, the west wind whispers its tune at a brisk pace, setting a scene perfect for a contemplative evening. Though a slight chance of rain lingers, the moisture will be timid, likely yielding a mere drizzle that only graces the pavement—an evening beckoning introspection rather than celebration.

Tomorrow's dawn whispers of possibility. A mix of fleeting sun and the errant rain shall play out, hinting at delightful surprises nestled amidst the mild temperatures. As tumultuous clouds sway above, those creating plans should choose layers wisely—perhaps a soft sweater under a light jacket, ready to embrace the shifts between warmth and chill. The allure of the day lies in going for a gentle stroll down the Embarcadero with a warm mug in hand, or perhaps exploring the nooks of your favorite neighborhood bookstore, where the comfort of literature and fragrance of fresh coffee can wrap you in solace while the elements outside engage in their own cinematic drama.
